algorithm_technique: Two pointers to swap letters from both ends, skipping non-letters.
problem_summary_simple: Reverse only the English letters in a string, keeping non-letters in their original positions.
problem_summary_technical: Use two pointers, one from the start and one from the end, to swap English letters while preserving non-letter positions.
key_insights: A two-pointer approach is efficient for in-place reversal.
Helper function or check to identify English letters is necessary.
Building a new string or modifying a list of characters is required as strings are immutable.
